result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Zacariah W Stoklasa in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court appoints Attorney Andrew Harrington.  Attorney fees to be repaid at $150/month with first payment due 5/31/15 by wage assignment.

Plea of Not Guilty  Plea hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
